Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary
See also: boxer and bóxer

English

[edit]
English Wikipedia has an article on:
Boxer (disambiguation)
Wikipedia

Etymology

[edit]

Named Boxers by the West, since their official title was "The Fist of Righteous Harmony" (義和拳 / 义和拳 (Yìhéquán)) and their symbol was a clenched fist.

Noun

[edit]

Boxer (plural Boxers)

  2. (historical) A Chinese anti-imperial and xenophobic rebel of the early 1900s.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • Boxerism
  • Boxer Rebellion, Boxer Uprising

Translations

[edit]
participant in the Boxer Rebellion
  • Arabic: مُلَاكَم m (mulākam), مُلَاكَمَة (ar) f (mulākama)
  • Chinese:
    Cantonese: 義和團 / 义和团 (ji6 wo4 tyun4)
    Mandarin: 義和團 / 义和团 (zh) (Yìhétuán)
  • Finnish: boksari (fi)
  • Japanese: 義和団 (ぎわだん, Giwadan)
  • Korean: 의화단(義和團) (ko) (Uihwadan)
  • Russian: ихэтуа́нь (ru) m (ixɛtuánʹ), боксёр (ru) m (boksjór)
  • Spanish: bóxer (es) m
  • Vietnamese: Nghĩa Hoà Đoàn (義和團)

Proper noun

[edit]

Boxer

  2. A surname.

Anagrams

[edit]
  • rebox

German

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

boxen +‎ -er

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈbɔksɐ/
  • Audio (Germany (Berlin)):(file)

Noun

[edit]

Boxer m (strong, genitive Boxers, plural Boxer, feminine Boxerin)

  1. boxer
    Synonym: Faustkämpfer

Declension

[edit]
Declension of Boxer [masculine, strong]
singular plural
indef. def. noun def. noun
nominative ein der Boxer die Boxer
genitive eines des Boxers der Boxer
dative einem dem Boxer den Boxern
accusative einen den Boxer die Boxer

Hypernyms

[edit]
  • Sportler

Hyponyms

[edit]
  • Amateurboxer, Berufsboxer, Hobbyboxer, Profiboxer

Related terms

[edit]
  • Boxhandschuh, Boxkampf, Boxring, Boxsport, Boxtrainer
  • Amateurboxen, Hobbyboxen, Boxerei

Further reading

[edit]
  • “Boxer” in Digitales Wörterbuch der deutschen Sprache
  • “Boxer” in Uni Leipzig: Wortschatz-Lexikon
  • “Boxer” in Duden online
